edu.uci.calismall

Class Stroke

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uci.calismall.CaliSmallElement
      • edu.uci.calismall.Stroke
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JSONSerializable<Stroke>, Comparable<CaliSmallElement>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RectStroke

     class Stroke
extends CaliSmallElement
implements JSONSerializable<Stroke>
    Contains a Path and all of the style attributes to be set to the Paint object used to draw it on canvas.

    Every time View.onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas) is called all strokes are rendered according to their styles by updating the Paint object according to what's in this object.

    Author:
    Michele Bonazza

    • Method Detail

      • addAndDrawPoint

        public boolean addAndDrawPoint(PointF newPoint,
                      float touchTolerance)
        Adds a point to this stroke if it's at least touchTolerance far from the last point of this stroke.

        If newPoint is too close to the previous point it's not added and this method returns false.

        This method assumes that setStart(PointF) has been called once for this Stroke.

        Parameters:
        newPoint - the new point to be added to this stroke
        touchTolerance - the distance from the last point in this Stroke under which newPoint is to be ignored
        Returns:
        true if the point has been added to this stroke

        public Path getPath()
        Returns the vector path for this stroke.
        Returns:
        the path

        Returns whether this stroke is empty, i.e. if it only contains an empty path.
        Returns:
        true if the underlying path is empty

        Returns whether this stroke is to be considered a tap according to the argument threshold.
        Parameters:
        tapThreshold - the maximum size of the enclosing rectangle for strokes that are to be considered taps
        Returns:
        true if this stroke is a tap

      • setGhost

        public Stroke setGhost(boolean isGhost,
              RectF screenBounds,
              Resources resources,
              float buttonSize)
        Marks this stroke as a ghost stroke or revives a stroke that was previously marked as ghost.

        Ghost strokes are strokes that were the outer border of a temporary scrap that was deselected. They are displayed with a low opacity and can be restored to regular strokes by pressing a button that pops up as soon as the temp scrap is deselected.

        If users interact with the originary temp scrap, ghost strokes are immediately deleted to avoid polluting the screen for no reason: the purpose of ghost strokes is to let users recover from accidentally hitting the landing zone and creating a selection, whereas a regular stroke was meant to be drawn.

        After some time, ghost strokes disappear and cannot be recovered anymore.

        Parameters:
        isGhost - whether this stroke is to be set as a ghost
        screenBounds - the current screen bounds
        resources - the resources to load the ghost revive bitmap from
        buttonSize - the size for the ghost revive button
        Returns:
        this stroke

      • isGhost

        public boolean isGhost()
        Returns whether this stroke is currently marked as a ghost stroke.

        Ghost strokes are strokes that were the outer border of a temporary scrap that was deselected without the user having done anything with the temp scrap. They are displayed with a low opacity and can be restored to regular strokes by pressing a button that pops up as soon as the temp scrap is deselected.

        If users interact with the originary temp scrap, ghost strokes are immediately deleted to avoid polluting the screen for no reason: the purpose of ghost strokes is to let users recover from accidentally hitting the landing zone and creating a selection, whereas a regular stroke was meant to be drawn.

        After some time, ghost strokes disappear and cannot be recovered anymore. At that time, this method starts returning false.

        Returns:
        true if this stroke is currently marked as a ghost

      • ghostButtonTouched

        public Stroke ghostButtonTouched(PointF touchPoint)
        If the ghost button associated with this stroke must be triggered when the argument point is touched it returns a reference to this stroke, otherwise the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        touchPoint - the touched point
        Returns:
        this stroke if its ghost revive button should be triggered, null otherwise

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this stroke, clearing all points.

        After a call to this method, setStart(PointF) must be called again to use this stroke.

        Overrides:

      • setGhostAnimationOnPause

        public void setGhostAnimationOnPause(boolean isPaused,
                            RectF screenBounds,
                            float buttonSize)
        Sets whether the ghost revive (pencil) icon should be drawn, and whether the ghost fade out animation should be executed.
        Parameters:
        isPaused - true if the animation should be put on pause and the ghost revive button not be drawn
        screenBounds - the current screen bounds, can and should be null if doDraw is false
        buttonSize - the current size of buttons, can and should be -1 if doDraw is false

      • getPointsForInclusionTests

        public List<PointF> getPointsForInclusionTests()
        Description copied from class: CaliSmallElement
        Returns a list of all points that must be tested when performing inclusion tests.

        This method is not required to make defensive copies, so altering the returned may alter the internal state of the object.

        Specified by:
        getPointsForInclusionTests in class CaliSmallElement
        Returns:
        a list containing all points of this element that must be included within some area for this element to be contained within said area
